name: Basic Task Resolution
description: To resolve a task, roll 1d100 and add relevant attribute and skill modifiers. Compare against difficulty class (DC) to determine success or failure.
rules: Roll 1d100 + Attribute Modifier + Skill Value
Compare result against DC: 60 (Easy), 70 (Average), 80 (Challenging), 90 (Difficult), 100+ (Very Difficult)
Success if roll meets or exceeds DC

name: Combat Initiative
description: Determines order of actions in combat rounds.
rules: Roll 1d100 + Perception modifier + initiative bonuses
Characters act in descending order of initiative results
Tied initiative results are resolved by higher Perception, then Dexterity

name: Attack Resolution
description: System for resolving attack attempts in combat.
rules: Roll 1d100 + Dexterity modifier + relevant weapon skill
If using firearms, apply range penalties (-10 medium range, -20 long range)
Compare against target's defense value (60 + Dexterity modifier + armor/shield bonuses)
Success if roll meets or exceeds target's defense

name: Damage Resolution
description: System for calculating damage from successful attacks.
rules: Roll weapon damage dice (e.g., 2d8+5)
Apply attribute bonuses (e.g., STR/5 for melee weapons, INT/5 for some energy weapons)
Subtract target's armor value from damage
Apply any special damage effects (critical hits, armor penetration, etc.)
Subtract final damage from target's hit points

name: Hit Points
description: Represents a character's ability to avoid serious injury.
rules: Base HP = Vitality x 2
Add any bonus HP from traits, advantages, or equipment
HP is divided among body parts (Head, Torso, Arms, Legs)
Characters are incapacitated when any vital body part reaches 0 HP

name: Critical Hits
description: Special attacks that cause additional damage or effects.
rules: Critical hit occurs on attack roll of 95-100 (varies by Perception)
Roll on critical hit table for location and effect
Effects can include bonus damage, status effects, or targeted injuries

name: Psionics
description: System for using and resolving psionic abilities.
rules: Psionic powers are based on PSY attribute
Each power costs Mana Points to activate
Mana Pool = PSY x 2 + modifiers
To use a power, roll 1d100 + PSY modifier + relevant skill
Compare against power's difficulty or target's resistance

name: Experience and Advancement
description: System for character growth and improvement.
rules: Characters earn Experience Points (XP) for completing objectives, combat, and role-playing
XP can be spent to improve attributes (cost = new value x 10)
XP can be spent to improve skills (cost = new value x 5)
XP can be spent to acquire new traits or advantages (cost varies)

name: Skill Checks
rules: Base DC for skill checks is determined by difficulty
Roll 1d100 + relevant attribute modifier + skill value
Critical success on roll of 95+ (regardless of DC)
Critical failure on roll of 5 or less (regardless of modifiers)

name: Healing and Recovery
description: Rules for natural healing and medical treatment.
rules: Natural healing: Recover VIT/10 HP per day of rest
First Aid: Heal 1d8 HP immediately, usable once per wound
Medical Treatment: Heal 2d8 HP, requires medical skill and supplies
Critical injuries require specialized treatment and longer recovery times
